intro: Piriqueta sarae var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth piriqueta, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The variety glabrescens is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to other variants, giving it a smoother appearance. It typically thrives in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
